results.content: Overall this was a great introductory course.  Many concepts were covered and various tools were presented that will be useful in Web development.  I would recommend this course for anyone wanting to get an overall feel for what goes into the construction of a good solid Web site.
results.content_html: Overall this was a great introductory course. Many concepts were covered and various tools were presented that will be useful in Web development. I would recommend this course for anyone wanting to get an overall feel for what goes into the construction of a good solid Web site.

results.content: Some terms are not adequately described. I find the frequent use of 'um' distracting. Some concepts of the MySQL portion were not gone into sufficient depth.
results.content_html: Some terms are not adequately described. I find the frequent use of 'um' distracting. Some concepts of the MySQL portion were not gone into sufficient depth.

results.content: Course is built on the "sneak peeks" of different courses. It's a strange way of presenting this course on Udemy. There are about 5 different courses which were put together one after another. Overall, information was useful for me. But some courses were more interesting than others.
results.content_html: Course is built on the "sneak peeks" of different courses. It's a strange way of presenting this course on Udemy. There are about 5 different courses which were put together one after another. Overall, information was useful for me. But some courses were more interesting than others.

results.content: Even though some of the information within the lectures were over my head, I was able to get a lot of useful information that I am very sure will help my progress alot! I am just now learning HTML and CSS so I hope later to advance to mysql and php etc. Thank you for such a good course and I look forward to more.

results.content: This course crashed in the early stages, after I downloaded the Komodo Editor. It kept freezing, and then automatically jumping onto further Lectures, but then freezing, then coming back to previous Lectures, and repeating the same process. In the end I had to close down the whole website, but when relaunched the same happened; hard booting did nothing to restore the course. I think I'll have to give this course a miss. Pity, because I was really enjoying it. Thanks.
results.content_html: This course crashed in the early stages, after I downloaded the Komodo Editor. Pity, because I was really enjoying it. Thanks.
